mods.abstract: Photograph of a newspaper clipping featuring a group portrait of county officials outside the Hardeman County Courthouse. The clipping from the Bolivar Bulletin is dated Thursday, October 11, 1973. Text towards the bottom of the clipping reads: "Hardeman County officials in 1902 are pictured seated on the steps of the courthouse. They included: seated, John Foote, county registrar; J.A. Foster, attorney; R.N. Mitchell, trustee; J.A. Wilson, chancery court clerk; Jessie Norment, deputy registrar; S.H. Jones, circuit court clerk; C.A. Miller, attorney; R.H. Wood, attorney; Will Sammons, sheriff, H.E. Carter, attorney; standing: A.J. Coats, attorney; Julius Crawford, county court clerk; W.T. Thompson, chairman of the county court; J.K. Tate and W.J. Cox, justices of the peace and J.P. Mitchell, Dept. trustee."

titleInfo.title: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
